meanings.definition: A mark or symbol of quality or genuineness
meanings.sent1: The gold ring had the hallmarks of authenticity engraved on it.
meanings.sent2: The certificate of authenticity bore the hallmarks of the renowned artist.
meanings.sent3: The detective's magnifying glass revealed the hallmarks on the ancient artifact.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness and compassion were the hallmarks of her character.
meanings.sent5: The old bookstore had the musty smell that was a hallmark of its charm.

meanings.sent1: The bright red color was the hallmark of the new sports car.
meanings.sent2: His quick wit and humor were the hallmarks of his personality.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous twinkle in his eye was the hallmark of his playful nature.
meanings.sent4: The soaring vocals of the singer became the hallmarks of her performances.
meanings.sent5: The intricate design was a hallmark of the skilled craftsman's work.

meanings.definition: A stamp or imprint indicating the standard of purity for precious metals
meanings.sent1: The jeweler carefully examined the hallmarks on the silver bracelet.
meanings.sent2: The collector always checked the hallmarks on the antique coins.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel left tiny hallmarks in the fresh snow.
meanings.sent4: The hallmarks on the gold bar confirmed its authenticity.
meanings.sent5: The hallmarks on the necklace indicated it was made of pure platinum.
